summary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 16 December to end of Friday 17 December GMT
description: A high pressure system centred over southern England will give settled weather conditions in Greater London throughout Thursday. <br/><br/>With very light winds, levels of PM10 and PM2.5 Particulates will rise in near-road environments as local emissions are poorly dispersed. Although 'Moderate' Particulates may occur by a few very heavily congested roadside locations, a continuing light feed of 'clean' Atlantic air and relatively mild temperatures should ensure that a widespread episode does not develop.<br/>Colder day with stronger winds on Friday. <br/><br/>Air pollution is largely expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide <br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates
disclaimerText: This is for learning purpose and does not reflect real data source. See https://next.github.com/projects/flat-data for Flat Data Info
